subsection.name: Hydrating (bi-directional)
subsection.p: In the below example Class A (dehydrated object) has a List with Car objects and a List with Van objects. Both of these objects is-a Vehicle. Class B (hydrated object) has a List with Vehicle objects. At the end of this mapping the Vehicle List will have one Car object and one Van object.

subsection.name: Dehydrating (bi-directional)
subsection.p: In the below example Class A (dehydrated object) has a List with Fruit objects. Class B (hydrated object) has a List with Apple objects and a List with Orange objects. Both of these objects is-a Fruit. At the end of this mapping the Fruit List will have one Apple object and one Orange object.
